revised_title: Stability of Loose Earth and the Role of Friction
tldr: This article investigates the mathematical theory of the frictional stability of a granular mass, focusing on the resistance to displacement and the role of the angle of repose. The author deduces the laws of stability from the principle of friction alone, without relying on other special principles. The findings have implications for understanding the stability of earth and soil mechanics.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Soil Mechanics
